answers.answer: Hi!If the disc problems have not worsened in the last few years, then you need to look at other possibilities. One possibility is definitely compression of spinal nerves up high up in cervical spine. This could be made worse by Vit B12 deficiency, anemia, vaso-vagal attack, multiple sclerosis, hypothyroidism, diabetes and panic attack. Do discuss this with your husband’s doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: My husband has for two years had tingle in his hands and feet now they are going numb, he can't get rid of a bad headache he throws up and caughs every morning and his lower back has been in pain for two years.  he has bouncy vision at times.  we are seeking a nurologist he has ordered two mri and this last one was of his neck the first one of his head this one reads no change from prior study two years ago.  no evidence of protruded or extruded disc.  Degenerative disc disease at C45, C5-6 and minimally at the C6-7 level with disc osteophyte complexes present.  He had surgery 5 years ago for the pain in his lower back.  the pain is worse and you can see his hip is way out of wack.  he has had problems working because the sitting or standing is making it worse.  what does all this mean?  the doctor is slow at reporting and we are feeling like it is worse everyday.
title: degenerative disc disease
